snippet: New York finds itself in the middle of what might be called a rich moment for art about the working class.
abstract: Randy Kennedy, in honor of Labor Day, highlights several exhibits at Brooklyn Museum, Whitney Museum of Art and Metropolitan Museum of Art that explore labor-themed art, featuring depictions of workers in paintings, sculptures, photos and other media.
lead_paragraph: New York finds itself in the middle of what might be called a rich moment for art about the working class.

headline.main: Take a Labor Day Tour of Blue-Collar Art
headline.print_headline: When Art’s Muse Worked Up a Sweat
